body: $PQEFF Ive been doing DD via the reddit page and Im starting to get really bullish long term. They already have 86 million barrels in reserve already worth approx $6 billion. In addition to the newly vetted technology the bidding company wants. The tech reduces emissions and allows extraction from previously unproducible lands. check out reddit for alot more information.

I think the company will not recommend taking this deal. They seemed to already be in negotiations with the company and rejected it. They should provide a plan to commercialize this tech or reach out to another company. I would think majors would love this tech. If its as good as I read
created_at: I would be surprised if another company doesnt come in for a better deal/partnership.

if they dont come out with any of that then I suspect the large majority would tender their shares. If they dilute the stock is screwed. Im good with an easy 3x but If they show they can commercialize quickly I wont tender

body: $PQEFF Here is a fun little mind game
created_at: obviously there are so many factors in determining a company‚Äôs value such as total assets and operating income etc
column3: but just for fun here are some major oil players and their oil reserves estimates
column4: Cenovus market cap $20B with reserves of 5B barrels
column5: BP market cap $85B with reserves of 10.7B barrels
column6: Royal Dutch Shell market cap $135B with reserves of 8.2B barrels
column7: Exxon market cap $242B with reserves of 9B barrels
column8: and the creme dela creme Petroteq market cap $100M as in Million with reserves (once validated as per the FEED study as proven reserves that can be extracted) of around 86M barrels on current leased lands and likely access through additional leases or licensing of estimated 14-25B barrels in all of Utah oil sands)
column9: of the majors above the low end (Cenovus) is 4x reserves to MC would put PQE at (86M x 4) $344M MC or about 63 cents per share
column10: but in the high end (Exxon) at a 26x puts PQE at (86M x 26) $2.236B MC or $4.10 per share!
